title: Causative: Have / Get Something Done
description: Слушайте каузативные конструкции: когда кто-то делает что-то для вас.

tasks.audioText: My car broke down on the motorway last week. I had it towed to the nearest garage for repairs.
tasks.transcript: I had it towed to the nearest garage for repairs.

options.text: I towed the car to the garage myself.
I arranged for someone to tow my car to a repair shop.
I left the car on the motorway and walked home.
I repaired the car on the side of the road.

tasks.explanation: 'Had it towed' is a causative structure meaning someone else towed the car for the speaker. Have + object + past participle.

tasks.audioText: Sarah wanted to look professional for her job interview. She got her suit dry-cleaned the day before.
tasks.transcript: She got her suit dry-cleaned the day before.

options.text: She washed her suit at home by hand.
She paid a professional service to clean her suit.
She bought a brand new suit for the interview.
She decided not to wear a suit to the interview.

tasks.explanation: 'Got her suit dry-cleaned' is the causative with 'get.' Someone else performed the cleaning service for her.

tasks.audioText: The CEO wanted a fresh look for the company website. She had the entire site redesigned by a top agency.
tasks.transcript: She had the entire site redesigned by a top agency.

options.text: She redesigned the website herself using a template.
She commissioned a leading agency to overhaul the website.
She kept the old website without any changes.
The agency refused to work on the project.

tasks.explanation: 'Had the site redesigned by' clearly shows the causative: the CEO arranged for the agency to do the work.

tasks.audioText: Our kitchen looks completely different now. We had new cabinets installed and the walls repainted last month.
tasks.transcript: We had new cabinets installed and the walls repainted last month.

options.text: We installed the cabinets and painted the walls ourselves.
We hired professionals to install cabinets and repaint the walls.
We only repainted the walls but didn't change the cabinets.
We are still planning the kitchen renovation.

tasks.explanation: Double causative: 'had cabinets installed' and 'walls repainted' — both done by others on their behalf.

tasks.audioText: Marcus needs to renew his passport before his trip to Australia. He is getting his passport photos taken at the pharmacy today.
tasks.transcript: He is getting his passport photos taken at the pharmacy today.

options.text: He is taking his own passport photos at home.
He is having someone at the pharmacy photograph him for his passport.
He already has his new passport ready.
He cancelled his trip to Australia.

tasks.explanation: 'Getting photos taken' is the causative with 'get' in present continuous. Someone at the pharmacy will take the photos.

tasks.audioText: Jennifer noticed a strange noise coming from her laptop. She had it checked by the IT department, but they found nothing wrong.
tasks.transcript: She had it checked by the IT department, but they found nothing wrong.

options.text: She asked IT to examine her laptop, and they didn't discover any problems.
She checked the laptop herself and fixed the issue.
The IT department found a serious problem with her laptop.
She bought a new laptop instead of getting hers repaired.

tasks.explanation: 'Had it checked by the IT department' — causative showing she arranged for IT professionals to inspect the device.

tasks.audioText: The old painting had faded over the decades and lost much of its colour. The museum had it restored by a team of expert conservators.
tasks.transcript: The museum had it restored by a team of expert conservators.

options.text: The museum staff restored the painting themselves.
The museum hired specialists to restore the artwork.
The museum decided to throw the old painting away.
The painting was never restored and remains faded.

tasks.explanation: 'Had it restored by' is a clear causative: the museum employed conservators to do the restoration work.

tasks.audioText: David's teeth were in terrible condition after years of neglect. He finally got them professionally cleaned and whitened at the dentist.
tasks.transcript: He finally got them professionally cleaned and whitened at the dentist.

options.text: He cleaned and whitened his teeth at home with a kit.
He had a dental professional clean and whiten his teeth.
He decided not to visit the dentist after all.
The dentist refused to treat his teeth.

tasks.explanation: 'Got them cleaned and whitened' — causative with 'get,' meaning the dentist performed the procedures for him.

tasks.audioText: The hotel manager received complaints about the old furniture in the rooms. She had all the beds and desks replaced within two weeks.
tasks.transcript: She had all the beds and desks replaced within two weeks.

options.text: She personally moved all the old furniture out of the rooms.
She kept the old furniture despite the complaints.
She arranged for new furniture to be put in place of the old.
Guests replaced the furniture themselves.

tasks.explanation: 'Had all the beds and desks replaced' — causative meaning she directed others to swap the old furniture for new.

tasks.audioText: Before the wedding ceremony, the bride was getting ready at a salon. She was having her hair styled and her makeup done by professionals.
tasks.transcript: She was having her hair styled and her makeup done by professionals.

options.text: She did her own hair and makeup at home.
Professional stylists were preparing her hair and makeup.
She cancelled the salon appointment.
Her friends helped her with hair and makeup.

tasks.explanation: 'Having her hair styled and makeup done' — past continuous causative showing ongoing services by professionals.

tasks.audioText: The company's security system was outdated and vulnerable to attacks. They got the entire system upgraded by a cybersecurity firm.
tasks.transcript: They got the entire system upgraded by a cybersecurity firm.

options.text: The company's own IT team upgraded the security system.
They hired an external cybersecurity company to improve their system.
They decided not to upgrade the security system.
The cybersecurity firm broke into their system.

tasks.explanation: 'Got the system upgraded by' — causative with 'get' and the agent specified. An outside firm did the upgrade work.

tasks.audioText: Olivia's bicycle chain keeps breaking during her commute. She needs to have it fixed properly this time at the bike shop.
tasks.transcript: She needs to have it fixed properly this time at the bike shop.

options.text: She wants a bike shop mechanic to repair the chain correctly.
She plans to fix the bicycle chain by herself.
She bought a new bicycle to replace the old one.
She stopped cycling to work because of the broken chain.

tasks.explanation: 'Have it fixed' — causative meaning she wants someone else (the bike shop) to do the repair properly.

tasks.audioText: The family wanted professional memories of their reunion. They had a photographer capture the entire event from start to finish.
tasks.transcript: They had a photographer capture the entire event from start to finish.

options.text: They took all the photos themselves with their phones.
They employed a professional to photograph the whole occasion.
They forgot to take any photos at the reunion.
The photographer cancelled at the last minute.

tasks.explanation: 'Had a photographer capture' uses the causative structure 'have + person + base form' to show they hired someone.

tasks.audioText: After winning the lottery, George decided to transform his garden. He got a swimming pool built and a tennis court laid in the backyard.
tasks.transcript: He got a swimming pool built and a tennis court laid in the backyard.

options.text: He built the pool and tennis court with his own hands.
He had builders construct a pool and tennis court for him.
He decided not to spend any of his lottery winnings.
He only got a swimming pool, not a tennis court.

tasks.explanation: 'Got a pool built and a court laid' — double causative with 'get' showing that professionals did the construction.

tasks.audioText: Linda's laptop was running extremely slowly and kept freezing. She had the hard drive replaced and the operating system reinstalled.
tasks.transcript: She had the hard drive replaced and the operating system reinstalled.

options.text: She replaced the hard drive and reinstalled the system herself.
She threw away the old laptop and bought a new one.
She arranged for a technician to swap the drive and reinstall the software.
The laptop is still running slowly despite the repairs.

tasks.explanation: 'Had the hard drive replaced and the OS reinstalled' — causative construction meaning a technician performed both tasks.
